author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Pondicherry Nursing Staff Welfare Association has expressed support to the agitation called by the All India Government Nurses Federation.

Hunger strike

Nurses in all Government Hospitals in the Union Territory will participate in a hunger strike in front of the Head Post Office in Puducherry on Monday protesting against the retrograde recommendations of the seventh pay commission.

K. Anuradha, secretary of the Pondicherry Nursing Staff Welfare Association, said that nurses in Government Hospitals across India had planned to go on mass casual leave on February 26 followed by an indefinite strike from March 15 if the Union Government failed to consider their demands. Ms. Anuradha said the commission had failed to increase the pay band of nurses and demanded a grade pay of Rs. 5,400 a month. Among other things, the Association has also demanded enhancement of nursing allowance, uniform and washing allowance, full salary during Child Care Leave (CCL) and time bound promotion for all nurses.
title: UT nurses’ association extends support to all India agitation on February 26
